User Settings¶

Contents

  • User Settings
    • Basic userSettings
    • Guru userSettings

Chaque CGMi possede son fichier userSettings. Le but de ce fichier est double. Il vise à :

  • renseigner les données d entrées du modele ( ex : les donnees anthropometriques, les options de calibration)
  • renseigner les acquisitions par condition d’analyse.

Ce fichier de configuration se veut le plus concis possible de maniere a rapidement dsitinguer le traitement ayant été réalisé.

Vous trouverez 2 niveaux de settings ( basic et Guru).

Je recommande de maitriser les fichiers Basic. Les fichiers Guru necessitent une connaissance profonde des CGM2.i

Basic userSettings¶

Voici exemple de fichier basic settings. Il est ecrit en yaml.

#CGM1 settings - version 1.0.0

#-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
SubjectInfo:
  Ipp:   000 # [string]-REQUIRED- identification number
  Name:      # [string]
  FirstName: # [string]
  Dob:       # [string] date of birth

#-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
VisitInfo:
  Date:          # [string]
  SessionNumber: # [string]
  Age:           # [int]
#-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

#-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
ExamInfo:
  Goal :         # [string]
  Comments:      # [string]
#-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MP:
    Required:
        Bodymass: 0              # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : kg - default 0
        Height: 0                # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm - default 0
        LeftLegLength: 0         # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm  - default 0
        RightLegLength: 0        # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm - default 0
        LeftKneeWidth: 0         # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm  - default 0
        RightKneeWidth: 0        # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm - default 0
        LeftAnkleWidth: 0        # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm - default 0
        RightAnkleWidth: 0       # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm - default 0
        LeftSoleDelta: 0         # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm  - default 0
        RightSoleDelta: 0        # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm - default 0
        LeftShoulderOffset: 0    # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm - default 0
        LeftElbowWidth: 0        # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm - default 0
        LeftWristWidth: 0        # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm - default 0
        LeftHandThickness: 0     # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm - default 0
        RightShoulderOffset: 0   # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm - default 0
        RightElbowWidth: 0       # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm - default 0
        RightWristWidth: 0       # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm - default 0
        RightHandThickness: 0    # [double] - REQUIRED- unit : mm - default 0
    Optional:
        InterAsisDistance: 0              # [double] - unit : mm - default 0
        LeftAsisTrocanterDistance: 0      # [double] - unit : mm - default 0
        LeftTibialTorsion: 0              # [double] - unit : deg - default 0
        LeftThighRotation: 0              # [double] - unit : deg - default 0
        LeftShankRotation: 0              # [double] - unit : deg - default 0
        RightAsisTrocanterDistance: 0     # [double] - unit : mm - default 0
        RightTibialTorsion: 0             # [double] - unit : deg - default 0
        RightThighRotation: 0             # [double] - unit : deg - default 0
        RightShankRotation: 0             # [double] - unit : deg - default 0
        LeftKneeFuncCalibrationOffset: 0  # [double] - unit : deg - default 0
        RightKneeFuncCalibrationOffset: 0 # [double] - unit : deg - default 0


Global:
    MarkerDiameter: 14     # [double] - REQUIRED - unit : mm - default 14
    PointSuffix:           # [string]


Calibration:
  - ID: 1                   # [string/int] - primary key identifying the calibration
    StaticTrial: static.c3d # [string]
    LeftFlatFoot: True      # [bool]
    RightFlatFoot: True     # [bool]
    HeadFlat: True          # [bool]

# In presence of a second static ( due to a marker repositionning for instance, you can add this line with the new ID)
  - ID: 2
    StaticTrial: static.c3d
    LeftFlatFoot: True
    RightFlatFoot: True
    HeadFlat: True

# the Fitting section only refers to files containing 3d marker position dealt with the CGM#i
Fitting:
    Trials:
        - File: gait.c3d               # [string]- REQUIRED
          CalibrationID: 1             # [string/int]- REQUIRED - reference to the calibration key
          Mfpa: XLR                    # [string]- REQUIRED- manual force plate assignement (here FP#1: Invalid - FP#2: Left - FP#3: Right)
          ConditionId: Condition1      # [string/int]- REQUIRED-  reference to the condition key ( see below)
          Emg: True                    # [bool]- REQUIRED - indicate if trial contains EMG also

        # for another trial, you can add the lines below
        - File: gait 2.c3d
          CalibrationID: 2             # NOTE : this trial points the CalibrationID #2
          Mfpa: XXX
          ConditionId: Condition1
          Emg: True


# the EMG section only refers to files containing EMG only.
Emg:
  Trials:
    - File: gait.c3d             # [string]- REQUIRED
      ConditionId: Condition2    # [string/int]- REQUIRED-  reference to the condition key ( see below)

#-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Protocol:
  ResearchProtocol:              # [string]- REQUIRED-

  # a Condition is a combinaison of factor characterizing the walking measurement
  Conditions:
    - ConditionID : Condition1  # [string/int]- REQUIRED- primary key identifying the condition
      Context : STANDARD        # [string]
      ContextComments:          # [string]
      Task: Spontaneous         # [string]
      Shoes: Barefoot           # [string]
      Orthosis:                 # [string]
      ExternalAid:              # [string]
      PersonalAid:              # [string]
      NerveBlock:               # [string]
      Assessor:                 # [string]
      EmgReferenceConditionID:  # [string] - reference to another condition for normalizing emg in amplitude
      EmgRepresentativeTrial: gait.c3d # [string] - filename of the representrative emg trial

    # you can have another condition ( slow-gait with shoes on). you can add the folowing line
    - ConditionID : Condition2
      Context : STANDARD
      ContextComments:
      Task: Slow gait
      Shoes: shoes
      Orthosis:
      ExternalAid:
      PersonalAid:
      NerveBlock:
      Assessor:
      EmgReferenceConditionID: Condition1  # [string] - emg normalisation from emg measurement of the condition 1
      EmgRepresentativeTrial: gait2.c3d #

Il est important de noter les relations “1-n” entre :

  • les elements de Calibration et les differents Trials de la section Fitting. UNE calibration peut etre appliquée a N trials de marche
  • les elements de Condition et les differents Trials des la section Fitting et emg. UNE condition de marche pointe sur N trials de marche
